P.title: Will there be Human-machine intelligence parity before 2040?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question resolves as YES if the machine system outscores at least two of the three humans on the following test prior to 2040, or NO otherwise. If no such tests are conducted, resolves as AMBIGUOUS.
Assume that prior to 2040, a generalized intelligence test will be administered as follows. A team of three expert interviewers will interact with a candidate machine system (MS) and three humans (3H). The humans will be graduate students in each of physics, mathematics and computer science from one of the top 25 research universities (per some recognized list), chosen independently of the interviewers. The interviewers will electronically communicate (via text, image, spoken word, or other means) an identical series of exam questions of their choosing over a period of two hours to the MS and 3H, designed to advantage the 3H. Both MS and 3H have full access to the internet, but no party is allowed to consult additional humans, and we assume the MS is not an internet-accessible resource. The exam will be scored blindly by a disinterested third party.
Note that this also effectively tests whether the internet as a whole functions as a human-level intelligence, in that a positive resolution indicates that the human participants are effectively superfluous.

Q_given_P.title: Given that there will be Human-machine intelligence parity before 2040, will perfect play in chess result in white winning if chess is solved before 2080?
Q_given_P.body: Resolves N/A if there is no Human-machine intelligence parity before 2040. If the condition is met (if there is Human-machine intelligence parity before 2040), then resolves YES if perfect play in chess must result in white winning if chess is solved before 2080, and NO if it must not result in white winning.

R_given_P_and_Q.title: Given that there will be Human-machine intelligence parity before 2040 AND if chess is solved before 2080, perfect play must result in white winning, will humans go extinct before 2100?
R_given_P_and_Q.body: Resolves N/A if the conditions are not met. If the conditions are met (if there is Human-machine intelligence parity before 2040 AND if chess is solved before 2080 with perfect play resulting in white winning), then resolves YES if there are no known humans alive on January 1, 2100. Resolves NO otherwise.

P_and_Q_and_R.title: Will there be Human-machine intelligence parity before 2040 AND if chess is solved before 2080, must perfect play result in white winning AND humans go extinct before 2100?
P_and_Q_and_R.body: Resolves YES if the machine system outscores at least two of the three humans on the intelligence test AND if chess is solved before 2080, perfect play must result in white winning AND there are no known humans alive on January 1, 2100. Resolves NO otherwise.

P.title: Will SpaceX land people on Mars before 2030?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if a SpaceX-branded mission successfully lands one or more living human beings on the surface of Mars before 2030. The landing itself of the human crew on Mars must occur before January 1, 2030, 00:00 UTC.
At least one person aboard the lander must survive the landing, however it is not necessary for the person to survive long-term or make a return trip to Earth, nor is it necessary for the mission to intend a return or long-term survival.
A "SpaceX-branded" mission is defined to mean that the SpaceX-associated logos on the spacecraft involved (both the boosters and the Mars-bound craft) have a larger surface area than the logos of any other entity

Q_given_P.title: Given that SpaceX lands people on Mars before 2030, will a sample of negative energy be produced by 2100?
Q_given_P.body: Resolves N/A if SpaceX does not land people on Mars before 2030. If the condition is met (if SpaceX lands people on Mars before 2030), then resolves YES if a sample of negative energy material is created by the year 2100 as specified in the resolution criteria for Q, and NO if it's not created by 2100.

R_given_P_and_Q.title: Given that SpaceX lands people on Mars before 2030 and a sample of negative energy is produced by 2100, will there be a Vegan Country by 2100?
R_given_P_and_Q.body: Resolves N/A if either of the conditions for P is not met. If both conditions are met (SpaceX lands people on Mars before 2030 and a sample of negative energy is produced by 2100), then resolves YES if there will be a Vegan Country by 2100 as defined in the question for Q, and NO if there won't be.

P_and_Q_and_R.title: Will SpaceX land people on Mars before 2030 AND will there be a Vegan Country by 2100?
P_and_Q_and_R.body: Resolves YES if a SpaceX-branded mission successfully lands one or more living human beings on the surface of Mars before 2030 AND there is a country that bans the consumption of all animal products by 2100. Resolves NO otherwise.

P.title: Will human brain emulation be the first successful route to human-level digital intelligence?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if an effort to create a viable (functioning, lasting, sane, etc.) emulated human, based on direct simulation of the neural connectome (and a requisite level of its physical instantiation), succeeds before another form of human-level digital intelligence. The latter will be defined as a digital entity capable of equalling or surpassing most or all core human cognitive capabilities.
If neither a whole human brain emulation nor a human-level digital intelligence has been successfully demonstrated before January 1, 2060, this question will resolve as Ambiguous.
*(Edit 10/20/18 to state that it resolves ambiguous rather than negative in the event of no AGI by 2060.)

Q_given_P.title: Given that human brain emulation is the first successful route to human-level digital intelligence, will we detect a message originating from Luyten's Star before 2046?
Q_given_P.body: Resolves N/A if human brain emulation is not the first successful route to human-level digital intelligence. If human brain emulation is the first successful route to human-level digital intelligence, then resolves YES if a signal of unambiguously intelligent and extraterrestrial origin originating from Luyten's Star is detected on or near Earth on or before December 31, 2045, and NO otherwise.

R_given_P_and_Q.title: Given that human brain emulation is the first successful route to human-level digital intelligence and we detect a message originating from Luyten's Star before 2046, will SpaceX land anything on Mars before 2030?
R_given_P_and_Q.body: Resolves N/A if either human brain emulation is not the first successful route to human-level digital intelligence or we do not detect a message originating from Luyten's Star before 2046. If both conditions are met (if human brain emulation is the first successful route to human-level digital intelligence and we detect a message from Luyten's Star before 2046), then resolves YES if a SpaceX-branded mission successfully lands on Mars by January 1, 2030, and NO otherwise.

P_and_Q_and_R.title: Will human brain emulation be the first successful route to human-level digital intelligence AND will we detect a message originating from Luyten's Star before 2046?
P_and_Q_and_R.body: Resolves YES if an effort to create a viable emulated human based on direct simulation of the neural connectome succeeds before another form of human-level digital intelligence AND a signal of unambiguously intelligent and extraterrestrial origin originating from Luyten's Star is detected on or near Earth on or before December 31, 2045. Resolves NO otherwise.

P.title: Will any country that had nuclear weapons on July 1, 2017 give them up before 2035?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if one of the 9 nations known to possess nuclear weapons on July 1, 2017 (U.S., China, Russia, U.K., France, Israel, India, Pakistan, or North Korea) is certified by the International Atomic Energy Agency to have dismantled all nuclear devices and signs the 2017 UN ban on nuclear weapons on or before January 1, 2035.
Fine Print
For the purposes of this question, in the case of territorial disputes or challenges to a government's legitimacy, successor governments will be recognized as those which hold over 50% of the nation's de facto controlled territory on July 1, 2017. The successor government must also hold a political capital city within that same territory. If any of the 9 countries no longer exist or have no succesor as defined by January 1, 2035, they will be ignored for the resolution of the question.

Q_given_P.title: Given that by 2035, a country that had nuclear weapons on July 1, 2017 gives them up, will humans go extinct before 2100?
Q_given_P.body: Resolves N/A if no country that had nuclear weapons on July 1, 2017 gives them up by 2035. If a country meets the condition (gives up nuclear weapons by 2035), then resolves YES if there are no known humans alive on January 1, 2100, according to the specified criteria, and NO if there are known humans alive on that date.

R_given_P_and_Q.title: Given that any country that had nuclear weapons on July 1, 2017 gives them up before 2035 AND humans do not go extinct before 2100, will Europa be the first place humanity will discover extraterrestrial life, if it is discovered before 2045?
R_given_P_and_Q.body: Resolves N/A if either condition is not met. If both conditions are fulfilled (if a country gives up nuclear weapons before 2035 and humans do not go extinct before 2100), then resolves YES if humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life elsewhere. Resolves NO if extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this question will be Annulled.

P_and_Q_and_R.title: Will any country that had nuclear weapons on July 1, 2017 give them up before 2035 AND will humans go extinct before 2100?
P_and_Q_and_R.body: Resolves YES if one of the 9 nations known to possess nuclear weapons on July 1, 2017 gives up their nuclear weapons before 2035 AND there are no known humans alive on January 1, 2100. Resolves NO otherwise.

P.title: Will Kessler syndrome occur before 2050?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if between 2018 to 2049 (inclusive), there is at least one calendar year when 10% or more of Earth's operational satellites become inoperable due to collisions with space debris

Q_given_P.title: Given that Kessler syndrome occurs before 2050, will Puerto Rico become a US state prior to 2035?
Q_given_P.body: Resolves N/A if Kessler syndrome does not occur before 2050. If Kessler syndrome occurs (if between 2018 to 2049, there is at least one calendar year when 10% or more of Earth's operational satellites become inoperable due to collisions with space debris), then resolves YES if Puerto Rico is admitted as a United States state before January 1, 2035, and NO if it's not admitted by that date.

R_given_P_and_Q.title: Given that Kessler syndrome occurs before 2050 and Puerto Rico becomes a US state prior to 2035, will the richest person in the world in 2033 have a net worth equivalent to or greater than 2% of the United States' GDP at the time?
R_given_P_and_Q.body: Resolves N/A if Kessler syndrome does not occur before 2050 or Puerto Rico does not become a US state prior to 2035. If both conditions are met (Kessler syndrome occurs before 2050 and Puerto Rico becomes a US state before 2035), then resolves YES if the richest person in the world in 2033 has a net worth equivalent to or greater than 2% of the United States' GDP at the time, and NO otherwise.

P_and_Q_and_R.title: Will Kessler syndrome occur before 2050 AND Puerto Rico become a US state prior to 2035?
P_and_Q_and_R.body: Resolves YES if between 2018 to 2049 (inclusive), there is at least one calendar year when 10% or more of Earth's operational satellites become inoperable due to collisions with space debris AND Puerto Rico is admitted as a United States state before January 1, 2035. Resolves NO otherwise.

P.title: Will the first commercial hyperloop system be within the US?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
Elon Musk's dream of a hyperloop – a pod-based transportation system that uses magnetic levitation in a near-vacuum – is coming closer to reality. Tests in the Nevada desert have achieved speeds up to 192 mph, and Musk announced in July 2017 that he had "verbal approval" for a hyperloop between New York and Washington, DC. (Though it is rather unclear what exactly this means.)
But other countries are interested too. Dubai and Russia are both developing plans. For Russia, a hyperloop could open up new areas of the country to trade with China. If, that is, lawsuits don't derail the project. In Dubai, designs for a Dubai-Abu Dhabi hyperloop network already exist.
Although implementing the hyperloop concept is far from easy, several writers have said that testing and construction should begin anyway, as the hyperloop may be the revolutionary transportation system the world desperately needs.
Will the first commercial hyperloop system be built inside of the United States?
This question will resolve as positive if the first hyperloop system to commence commercial operations is located the US rather than in Dubai, Russia, or any other country outside the US. Resolves as ambiguous if no commercial hyperloop system is operating as of 2035.
"Commerical Operations" means that people will utilize the system as transport (even if somewhat as a novelty) outside of a test setting and without signing any waivers etc.

Q_given_P.title: Given that the first commercial hyperloop system will be within the US, will a sample of negative energy be produced by 2100?
Q_given_P.body: Resolves N/A if the first commercial hyperloop system is not within the US. If the condition is met (if the first commercial hyperloop system is within the US, then resolves YES if a sample of negative energy material will be created by the year 2100 as specified and NO if it will not be created by 2100.

R_given_P_and_Q.title: Given that by 2100, the first commercial hyperloop system is built inside the United States and a sample of negative energy is produced, will there be a complete 4-year interval in which world output doubles before the first 1-year interval in which world output doubles?
R_given_P_and_Q.body: Resolves N/A if by 2100 either the first commercial hyperloop system is not built inside the US or a sample of negative energy is not produced. If both conditions are met, then resolves based on the criteria of world output doubling intervals as specified.

P_and_Q_and_R.title: Will the first US hyperloop system be built AND will a sample of negative energy be produced by 2100?
P_and_Q_and_R.body: Resolves YES if the first commercial hyperloop system is built in the US AND a sample of negative energy material exceeding 10 proton masses is created and confined to a volume of less than 1 cubic centimeter for longer than 1 microsecond by 2100. Resolves NO otherwise.

P.title: Will RoboCup announce that robots have beaten professional human soccer players before 2050?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if the RoboCup organization announces that its ultimate goal for robotic soccer has been accomplished before January 1, 2050.
Fine Print
If the RoboCup organization or a clear successor organization ceases to exist this question will be Annulled.
This question defers to announcements by the RoboCup organization, the rules and language regarding their ultimate goal may change so long as it refers to robots winning a game of soccer against professional human soccer players.
If the RoboCup organization still exists at the time of resolution and has not announced that its ultimate goal has been accomplished as described this question will resolve as No.
This question was updated on 16 November 2023 to clarify that a qualifying event must be a game of soccer played by professional human soccer players against robots.
This question was updated on 28 March 2023 to clarify some ambiguities and provide better context. The question text prior to this update is below:
Title: Robocup Challenge Win before 2050?
The Robocup Challenge was launched in the mid-1990s as a "grand challenge" in robotics. The stated goal of the challenge is:
By the middle of the 21st century, a team of fully autonomous humanoid robot soccer players shall win a soccer game, complying with the official rules of FIFA, against the winner of the most recent World Cup.
On the road to this challenge, annual Robocup games are played; see here for upcoming events.
Will Robots win the Robocup challenge, beating professional soccer players before 2050?
This question will resolve as Yes if a team of humanoid robots wins a professional match of soccer before January 1, 2050, as determined by the Robocup challenge organization.

Q_given_P.title: Given that before 2050, RoboCup announces that robots have beaten professional human soccer players, will there be more than 13 people off of planet Earth on December 31, 2050?
Q_given_P.body: Resolves N/A if RoboCup does not announce that robots have beaten professional human soccer players before 2050. If the condition is met (if RoboCup announces the accomplishment, then resolves YES if the population of humans off of planet Earth at midnight UTC time of December 31, 2050, is higher than 13 and NO if it's not.

R_given_P_and_Q.title: Given that on December 31, 2050, robots win the RoboCup challenge and there are more than 13 people off of planet Earth, will we detect a message originating from Luyten's Star before 2046?
R_given_P_and_Q.body: Resolves N/A if the conditions for robots winning the RoboCup challenge and there being more than 13 people off of planet Earth on December 31, 2050, are not met. If the conditions are met, then resolves YES if a signal of unambiguously intelligent and extraterrestrial origin originating from Luyten's Star is detected on or before December 31, 2045, and NO otherwise.

P_and_Q_and_R.title: Will robots win the RoboCup challenge and there be more than 13 people off of planet Earth on December 31, 2050 AND will we detect a message originating from Luyten's Star before 2046?
P_and_Q_and_R.body: Resolves YES if the RoboCup organization announces that its ultimate goal for robotic soccer has been accomplished AND the population of humans off of planet Earth at midnight UTC time of December 31, 2050, is higher than 13 AND a signal of unambiguously intelligent and extraterrestrial origin originating from Luyten's Star is detected on or before December 31, 2045. Resolves NO otherwise.

P.title: Will human brain emulation be the first successful route to human-level digital intelligence?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if an effort to create a viable (functioning, lasting, sane, etc.) emulated human, based on direct simulation of the neural connectome (and a requisite level of its physical instantiation), succeeds before another form of human-level digital intelligence. The latter will be defined as a digital entity capable of equalling or surpassing most or all core human cognitive capabilities.
If neither a whole human brain emulation nor a human-level digital intelligence has been successfully demonstrated before January 1, 2060, this question will resolve as Ambiguous.
*(Edit 10/20/18 to state that it resolves ambiguous rather than negative in the event of no AGI by 2060.)

Q_given_P.title: Given that human brain emulation is the first successful route to human-level digital intelligence, will perfect play in chess result in white winning if chess is solved before 2080?
Q_given_P.body: Resolves N/A if human brain emulation is not the first successful route to human-level digital intelligence. If the condition is met (if human brain emulation is the first successful route to human-level digital intelligence, then resolves YES if perfect play in chess must result in white winning when chess is solved before 2080, and NO if it does not.

R_given_P_and_Q.title: Given that human brain emulation is the first successful route to human-level digital intelligence AND if chess is solved before 2080 with perfect play resulting in white winning, will a practical nuclear fusion reactor first be developed in China?
R_given_P_and_Q.body: Resolves N/A if human brain emulation is not the first successful route to human-level digital intelligence or if chess is not solved before 2080 with perfect play resulting in white winning. If the conditions are met, resolves YES if a practical nuclear fusion reactor is first developed in China and NO if it is developed elsewhere. If no such reactor is built before January 1, 2050, this question will resolve as Ambiguous.

P_and_Q_and_R.title: Will human brain emulation be the first successful route to human-level digital intelligence AND will a practical nuclear fusion reactor first be developed in China?
P_and_Q_and_R.body: Resolves YES if an effort to create a viable emulated human based on direct simulation of the neural connectome succeeds before another form of human-level digital intelligence AND the first practical nuclear fusion reactor meeting specific criteria is built in China. Resolves NO otherwise.

P.title: Will the European Union meet its 2030 targets under the Paris Climate Treaty?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if a credible news report cites an analysis independent of the European Union government confirming that Europe has met all three 2030 climate action goals, including emission reduction by at least 40% below 1990 levels, on or before January 1, 2030.
Fine Print
The EU has updated its goals under the Paris Agreement, but this question will use the original goals in place at the time the question was written, specifically the three below.
40% reduction in greenhouse gas emissions by 2030, compared to 2019
At least 27% of total energy consumption from renewable energy
At least 27% increase in energy efficiency in comparison with projections

Q_given_P.title: Given that the European Union meets its 2030 targets under the Paris Climate Treaty, will there be a Vegan Country by 2100?
Q_given_P.body: Resolves N/A if the European Union does not meet its 2030 targets under the Paris Climate Treaty. If the condition is met (if the EU meets its 2030 targets, then resolves YES if there will be a country that bans the consumption of all animal products by 2100 and NO if there won't be such a country by 2100.

R_given_P_and_Q.title: Given that the European Union meets its 2030 climate targets and there is a Vegan Country by 2100, will Metaculus exist in 2030?
R_given_P_and_Q.body: Resolves N/A if the conditions are not met. If the European Union meets its 2030 climate targets and there is a Vegan Country by 2100, then resolves according to the criteria for Metaculus existing in 2030 as specified in the resolution criteria for the Metaculus question.

P_and_Q_and_R.title: Will the European Union meet its 2030 climate targets AND will there be a Vegan Country by 2100 AND will Metaculus exist in 2030?
P_and_Q_and_R.body: Resolves YES if a credible news report confirms that Europe has met its 2030 climate action goals AND there is a country that bans the consumption of all animal products by 2100 AND the criteria for Metaculus existence in 2030 are met. Resolves NO otherwise.

P.title: Will RoboCup announce that robots have beaten professional human soccer players before 2050?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if the RoboCup organization announces that its ultimate goal for robotic soccer has been accomplished before January 1, 2050.
Fine Print
If the RoboCup organization or a clear successor organization ceases to exist this question will be Annulled.
This question defers to announcements by the RoboCup organization, the rules and language regarding their ultimate goal may change so long as it refers to robots winning a game of soccer against professional human soccer players.
If the RoboCup organization still exists at the time of resolution and has not announced that its ultimate goal has been accomplished as described this question will resolve as No.
This question was updated on 16 November 2023 to clarify that a qualifying event must be a game of soccer played by professional human soccer players against robots.
This question was updated on 28 March 2023 to clarify some ambiguities and provide better context. The question text prior to this update is below:
Title: Robocup Challenge Win before 2050?
The Robocup Challenge was launched in the mid-1990s as a "grand challenge" in robotics. The stated goal of the challenge is:
By the middle of the 21st century, a team of fully autonomous humanoid robot soccer players shall win a soccer game, complying with the official rules of FIFA, against the winner of the most recent World Cup.
On the road to this challenge, annual Robocup games are played; see here for upcoming events.
Will Robots win the Robocup challenge, beating professional soccer players before 2050?
This question will resolve as Yes if a team of humanoid robots wins a professional match of soccer before January 1, 2050, as determined by the Robocup challenge organization.

Q_given_P.title: Given that RoboCup announces that robots have beaten professional human soccer players before 2050, will there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
Q_given_P.body: Resolves N/A if RoboCup does not announce that robots have beaten professional human soccer players before 2050. If the condition is met (if RoboCup announces that robots have beaten professional human soccer players before 2050), then resolves YES if there is at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100 and NO if there is not.

R_given_P_and_Q.title: Given that RoboCup announces robots beating professional human soccer players before 2050 and there is at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100, will we detect a message originating from Luyten's Star before 2046?
R_given_P_and_Q.body: Resolves N/A if the conditions for RoboCup and global warming are not met. If the conditions are met (RoboCup announces robots beating professional human soccer players before 2050 and there is at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100), then resolves YES if a signal of unambiguously intelligent and extraterrestrial origin originating from Luyten's Star is detected on or before December 31, 2045, and NO otherwise.

P_and_Q_and_R.title: Will RoboCup announce robots beating professional human soccer players before 2050 AND will we detect a message originating from Luyten's Star before 2046?
P_and_Q_and_R.body: Resolves YES if the RoboCup organization announces that its ultimate goal for robotic soccer has been accomplished before January 1, 2050 AND a signal of unambiguously intelligent and extraterrestrial origin originating from Luyten's Star is detected on or near Earth on or before December 31, 2045. Resolves NO otherwise.

P.title: Will China reduce their carbon emissions per GDP by 60% by 2030?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes China meets its primary 2030 climate action goals of cutting emissions intensity by at least 60% below 2005 levels on or before January 1, 2030, according to expert analysis independent of the Chinese government

Q_given_P.title: Given that China reduces their carbon emissions per GDP by 60% by 2030, will we detect a message originating from Luyten's Star before 2046?
Q_given_P.body: Resolves N/A if China does not reduce their carbon emissions per GDP by 60% by 2030. If the condition is met (if China reduces emissions as specified by 2030, then resolves YES if a signal of unambiguously intelligent and extraterrestrial origin originating from Luyten's Star is detected on or near Earth on or before December 31, 2045 and NO if it's not detected by then.

R_given_P_and_Q.title: Given that China achieves a 60% reduction in carbon emissions per GDP by 2030 AND we detect a message from Luyten's Star before 2046, will we reach the island of stability by 2050?
R_given_P_and_Q.body: Resolves N/A if either of the conditions is not met. If both conditions are met (China achieves the emission reduction target and a message from Luyten's Star is detected before 2046), then resolves YES if we create an isotope of an element with more than 110 protons that has a half-life of at least one day prior to 2050, verified by an independent scientific team. Resolves NO otherwise.

P_and_Q_and_R.title: Will China achieve a 60% reduction in carbon emissions per GDP by 2030 AND will we detect a message from Luyten's Star before 2046?
P_and_Q_and_R.body: Resolves YES if China meets its primary 2030 climate action goals of cutting emissions intensity by at least 60% below 2005 levels AND a signal of unambiguously intelligent and extraterrestrial origin originating from Luyten's Star is detected on or near Earth on or before the specified dates. Resolves NO otherwise.

P.title: Will any country that had nuclear weapons on July 1, 2017 give them up before 2035?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if one of the 9 nations known to possess nuclear weapons on July 1, 2017 (U.S., China, Russia, U.K., France, Israel, India, Pakistan, or North Korea) is certified by the International Atomic Energy Agency to have dismantled all nuclear devices and signs the 2017 UN ban on nuclear weapons on or before January 1, 2035.
Fine Print
For the purposes of this question, in the case of territorial disputes or challenges to a government's legitimacy, successor governments will be recognized as those which hold over 50% of the nation's de facto controlled territory on July 1, 2017. The successor government must also hold a political capital city within that same territory. If any of the 9 countries no longer exist or have no succesor as defined by January 1, 2035, they will be ignored for the resolution of the question.

Q_given_P.title: Given that any country that had nuclear weapons on July 1, 2017, gives them up before 2035, will there be a complete 4-year interval in which world output doubles before the first 1-year interval in which world output doubles?
Q_given_P.body: Resolves N/A if none of the 9 nations known to possess nuclear weapons on July 1, 2017, give them up before 2035. If the condition is met (if any of the 9 nations give up nuclear weapons before 2035), then resolves based on the resolution criteria of question Q.

R_given_P_and_Q.title: Given that by January 1, 2035, a country that had nuclear weapons on July 1, 2017 gives them up and there is a complete 4 year interval in which world output doubles before the first 1 year interval in which world output doubles, will a practical nuclear fusion reactor first be developed in China?
R_given_P_and_Q.body: Resolves N/A if the conditions mentioned are not met by January 1, 2035. If the conditions are met, then resolves YES if the first practical nuclear fusion reactor is developed in China and NO if it is developed elsewhere. If no such reactor is built before January 1, 2050, the question will resolve as Ambiguous.

P_and_Q_and_R.title: Will any country that had nuclear weapons on July 1, 2017 give them up before 2035 AND will there be a complete 4 year interval in which world output doubles before the first 1 year interval in which world output doubles?
P_and_Q_and_R.body: Resolves YES if one of the 9 nations known to possess nuclear weapons on July 1, 2017 is certified by the International Atomic Energy Agency to have dismantled all nuclear devices and signs the 2017 UN ban on nuclear weapons on or before January 1, 2035 AND there is a complete 4 year interval in which world output doubles before the first 1 year interval in which world output doubles. Resolves NO otherwise.

P.title: Will human brain emulation be the first successful route to human-level digital intelligence?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if an effort to create a viable (functioning, lasting, sane, etc.) emulated human, based on direct simulation of the neural connectome (and a requisite level of its physical instantiation), succeeds before another form of human-level digital intelligence. The latter will be defined as a digital entity capable of equalling or surpassing most or all core human cognitive capabilities.
If neither a whole human brain emulation nor a human-level digital intelligence has been successfully demonstrated before January 1, 2060, this question will resolve as Ambiguous.
*(Edit 10/20/18 to state that it resolves ambiguous rather than negative in the event of no AGI by 2060.)

Q_given_P.title: Given that human brain emulation is the first successful route to human-level digital intelligence, will Puerto Rico become a US state prior to 2035?
Q_given_P.body: Resolves N/A if human brain emulation is not the first successful route to human-level digital intelligence. If the condition is met (if human brain emulation is the first successful route to human-level digital intelligence, then resolves YES if Puerto Rico is admitted as a United States state before January 1, 2035 and NO if it's not admitted by that date.

R_given_P_and_Q.title: Given that human brain emulation is the first successful route to human-level digital intelligence before 2035 and Puerto Rico becomes a US state, will we discover clear evidence of proton decay by 2040?
R_given_P_and_Q.body: Resolves N/A if human brain emulation is not the first successful route to human-level digital intelligence before 2035 or if Puerto Rico does not become a US state. If both conditions are met (if human brain emulation is the first successful route to human-level digital intelligence before 2035 and Puerto Rico becomes a US state), then resolves YES if experimental evidence for proton decay is published in a top peer-reviewed journal prior to 2040, and NO otherwise.

P_and_Q_and_R.title: Will human brain emulation be the first successful route to human-level digital intelligence AND Puerto Rico become a US state prior to 2035 AND clear evidence of proton decay be discovered by 2040?
P_and_Q_and_R.body: Resolves YES if an effort to create a viable emulated human based on direct simulation of the neural connectome succeeds before another form of human-level digital intelligence AND Puerto Rico is admitted as a United States state before January 1, 2035 AND experimental evidence for proton decay is published in a top peer-reviewed journal prior to 2040. Resolves NO otherwise.

P.title: Will the European Union meet its 2030 targets under the Paris Climate Treaty?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if a credible news report cites an analysis independent of the European Union government confirming that Europe has met all three 2030 climate action goals, including emission reduction by at least 40% below 1990 levels, on or before January 1, 2030.
Fine Print
The EU has updated its goals under the Paris Agreement, but this question will use the original goals in place at the time the question was written, specifically the three below.
40% reduction in greenhouse gas emissions by 2030, compared to 2019
At least 27% of total energy consumption from renewable energy
At least 27% increase in energy efficiency in comparison with projections

Q_given_P.title: Given that the European Union meets its 2030 targets under the Paris Climate Treaty, will there be more VR headset sales than AR headset sales in 2025?
Q_given_P.body: Resolves N/A if the European Union does not meet its 2030 targets under the Paris Climate Treaty. If the condition is met (if the EU meets its 2030 targets, then resolves YES if the number of virtual reality headsets sold globally in 2025 exceeds the number of augmented reality headsets sold in the same year, based on credible industry reports, and NO otherwise.

R_given_P_and_Q.title: Given that the European Union meets its 2030 climate targets AND there are more VR headset sales than AR headset sales in 2025, will the richest person in the world in 2033 have a net worth equivalent to or greater than 2% of the United States' GDP at the time?
R_given_P_and_Q.body: Resolves N/A if the European Union does not meet its 2030 climate targets or if there are not more VR headset sales than AR headset sales in 2025. If both conditions are met (EU meets climate targets and VR sales exceed AR sales in 2025), then resolves YES if the richest person in the world in 2033 has a net worth equivalent to or greater than 2% of the United States' GDP at that time, and NO otherwise.

P_and_Q_and_R.title: Will the European Union meet its 2030 climate targets AND will the richest person in the world in 2033 have a net worth equivalent to or greater than 2% of the United States' GDP at the time?
P_and_Q_and_R.body: Resolves YES if a credible news report confirms that Europe has met all three 2030 climate action goals AND the richest person in the world in 2033 has a net worth equivalent to or greater than 2% of the United States' GDP at the time. Resolves NO otherwise.

P.title: Will gravitational waves from the merger of supermassive black holes be detected by November 30, 2027?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as positive if by November 30, 2027, a peer-reviewed publication announces the results of such an event. Statistical significance should be at the 4-sigma or equivalent level.
*(edit 1/1017) November 30 is now a publication date rather than data cutoff date.

Q_given_P.title: Given that by November 30, 2027, gravitational waves from the merger of supermassive black holes are detected, will we detect a message originating from Luyten's Star before 2046?
Q_given_P.body: Resolves N/A if the detection of gravitational waves from the merger of supermassive black holes is not announced by November 30, 2027. If the condition is met (if the detection is announced by Nov 30, 2027), then resolves YES if a signal of unambiguously intelligent and extraterrestrial origin originating from Luyten's Star is detected on or before December 31, 2045, and NO if it's not detected by then.

R_given_P_and_Q.title: Given that by November 30, 2027, gravitational waves from the merger of supermassive black holes are detected AND a message originating from Luyten's Star is detected before 2046, will Metaculus exist in 2030?
R_given_P_and_Q.body: Resolves N/A if either of the conditions is not met. If both conditions are met (if gravitational waves from the merger of supermassive black holes are detected by Nov 30, 2027, and a message from Luyten's Star is detected before 2046), then resolves YES if Metaculus exists in 2030 according to the specified criteria, and NO if it does not meet the criteria.

P_and_Q_and_R.title: Will we detect gravitational waves from the merger of supermassive black holes by November 30, 2027 AND will we receive a message from Luyten's Star before 2046?
P_and_Q_and_R.body: Resolves YES if by November 30, 2027, a peer-reviewed publication announces the results of detecting gravitational waves from the merger of supermassive black holes AND a signal of unambiguously intelligent and extraterrestrial origin originating from Luyten's Star is detected on or near Earth on or before December 31, 2045. Resolves NO otherwise.

P.title: If chess is solved before 2080, must perfect play result in white winning?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
Zermelo's theorem says that only one of three possibilities is possible in a 2-player solved game; First player (white) wins, second player (black) wins, or there is a forced draw.
In the game of chess, these outcomes correspond to:
White wins
Black wins
Forced draw
If chess is solved before 2080, must perfect play result in white winning?
For the purpose of this question, chess is considered to be solved if
it is proved that white will win, lose or draw from the initial position, given perfect play on both sides
it is shown that there exists a unique result of perfect play from the initial position, which is either: white wins, black wins, or forced draw
Resolution is by publication of peer-reviewed article that is not shown to be mistaken for at least 3 years post-publication.
For the purpose of this question, the 50-move rule does not force a draw. Games that don't end, are considered drawn, for the purpose of this question
This question resolves ambiguously if the question does not resolve before Jan 1st, 2080.

Q_given_P.title: Given that chess is solved before 2080 and perfect play results in white winning, will any country that had nuclear weapons on July 1, 2017 give them up before 2035?
Q_given_P.body: Resolves N/A if chess is not solved before 2080 or if perfect play does not result in white winning. If chess is solved before 2080 and perfect play results in white winning, then resolves YES if one of the 9 nations known to possess nuclear weapons on July 1, 2017 gives them up before 2035, according to the specified criteria, and NO otherwise.

R_given_P_and_Q.title: Given that chess is solved before 2080 with perfect play resulting in white winning and any country gives up nuclear weapons before 2035, will there be a complete 4-year interval in which world output doubles before the first 1-year interval in which world output doubles?
R_given_P_and_Q.body: Resolves N/A if either of the conditions is not met. If both conditions are met (chess is solved before 2080 with white winning and a country gives up nuclear weapons before 2035), then resolves based on the resolution criteria provided for Q.

P_and_Q_and_R.title: If chess is solved before 2080 and any country gives up nuclear weapons before 2035, will perfect play result in white winning and a country give up nuclear weapons respectively?
P_and_Q_and_R.body: Resolves YES if chess is solved before 2080 with perfect play resulting in white winning AND if any country that had nuclear weapons on July 1, 2017 gives them up before 2035. Resolves NO otherwise.

P.title: Will any of Belgium, France, Italy, Luxembourg, Netherlands, and/or Germany leave the EU before 2027?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2027, one or more of Belgium, France, Italy, Luxembourg, Netherlands, and/or Germany triggers Article 50 of the Treaty of Lisbon by notifying the European Council of its intention to leave the union.
It also resolves as positive if by the same deadline the entity called European Union has dissolved completely or dissolved to create a new politico-economic union of some European nations under a different name

Q_given_P.title: Given that before 2027, any of Belgium, France, Italy, Luxembourg, Netherlands, and/or Germany leave the EU, will China reduce their carbon emissions per GDP by 60% by 2030?
Q_given_P.body: Resolves N/A if none of the mentioned countries leave the EU before 2027. If any of the mentioned countries trigger Article 50 of the Treaty of Lisbon or the EU dissolves before 2027, then resolves YES if China meets its primary 2030 climate action goals of cutting emissions intensity by at least 60% below 2005 levels on or before January 1, 2030, according to expert analysis independent of the Chinese government and NO if it does not meet the goals.

R_given_P_and_Q.title: Given that before 2027, any of Belgium, France, Italy, Luxembourg, Netherlands, and/or Germany leave the EU AND China reduces their carbon emissions per GDP by 60% by 2030, will the first commercial hyperloop system be within the US?
R_given_P_and_Q.body: Resolves N/A if the conditions for P are not met. If the conditions are met (if any of the mentioned countries leave the EU and China reduces emissions as specified), then resolves as per the criteria for Q.

P_and_Q_and_R.title: Will any of Belgium, France, Italy, Luxembourg, Netherlands, and/or Germany leave the EU before 2027 AND will China reduce their carbon emissions per GDP by 60% by 2030 AND will the first commercial hyperloop system be within the US?
P_and_Q_and_R.body: Resolves YES if before January 1, 2027, one or more of Belgium, France, Italy, Luxembourg, Netherlands, and/or Germany triggers Article 50 of the Treaty of Lisbon OR the European Union dissolves completely or dissolves to create a new politico-economic union of some European nations under a different name AND China meets its primary 2030 climate action goals of cutting emissions intensity by at least 60% below 2005 levels on or before January 1, 2030, according to expert analysis independent of the Chinese government AND the first commercial hyperloop system to commence operations is located in the US. Resolves NO otherwise.

P.title: Will there be more VR headset sales than AR headsets sales in 2025?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as "Yes" if the number of virtual reality headsets sold globally in 2025 exceeds the number of augmented reality headsets sold in the same year. Credible industry reports will be required for resolution.
For the purposes of this question, an "augmented reality headset" is defined as a device which is portable and worn over the user's head, and whose primary use is in augmented reality functions. "Augmented reality functions" are defined as recognizing and interpreting objects in the user's real environment, and producing digital information and images overlaid over the user's view of their real environment, which update in real time as the user moves and interacts with the digital and physical environment.
For the purposes of this question, a "virtual reality headset" is defined as a device which is portable and worn over the user's head, and whose primary use is in virtual reality functions. "virtual reality functions" are defined as mostly or entirely covering the user's field of view, and tracking the user's viewpoint in 6 degrees of freedom, which the user can interact with through movement, voice, or other controls.
In the case that a device is capable of both AR and VR functionality, it will be considered an AR device only in the calculation of resolution. Devices such as smartphones in 2021, whose primary functions are not intended as AR or VR, do not qualify for the purposes of this question

Q_given_P.title: Given that in 2025 there are more VR headset sales than AR headset sales, will there be more than 13 people off of planet Earth on December 31, 2050?
Q_given_P.body: Resolves N/A if the condition about VR and AR headset sales is not met in 2025. If the condition is met (if there are more VR headset sales than AR headset sales in 2025), then resolves YES if the population of humans off of planet Earth at midnight UTC time of December 31, 2050, is higher than 13 and NO if it's not.

R_given_P_and_Q.title: Given that in 2025 there are more VR headset sales than AR headset sales AND there are more than 13 people off of planet Earth on December 31, 2050, will the Kessler syndrome occur before 2050?
R_given_P_and_Q.body: Resolves N/A if the conditions for P are not met. If the conditions are met (more VR headset sales than AR headset sales in 2025 and more than 13 people off of planet Earth on Dec 31, 2050), then resolves YES if the Kessler syndrome occurs before 2050 and NO if it does not occur before 2050.

P_and_Q_and_R.title: Will there be more VR headset sales than AR headsets sales in 2025 AND will there be more than 13 people off of planet Earth on December 31, 2050 AND will Kessler syndrome occur before 2050?
P_and_Q_and_R.body: Resolves YES if the number of virtual reality headsets sold globally in 2025 exceeds the number of augmented reality headsets sold in the same year AND the population of humans off of planet Earth at midnight UTC time of December 31, 2050, is higher than 13 AND there is at least one calendar year between 2018 to 2049 (inclusive) when 10% or more of Earth's operational satellites become inoperable due to collisions with space debris. Resolves NO otherwise.
